meanings.definition: To remove something that has been buried.
meanings.sent1: She is unburying the treasure chest from the sand.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist is unburying ancient artifacts from the site.
meanings.sent3: The dog is unburying its bone in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The truth slowly unburying itself from layers of deception.
meanings.sent5: The sun unburying the flowers with its warm rays.

meanings.definition: To uncover or reveal something that was hidden.
meanings.sent1: The detective is unburying the secrets of the case.
meanings.sent2: The journalist is unburying the corruption within the government.
meanings.sent3: The magician unburying a rabbit from his hat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile unburying the joy in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The artist unburying emotions through their paintings.

meanings.definition: To dig up or exhume something that was buried.
meanings.sent1: The grave digger is unburying the coffin for examination.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers are unburying the old pipes from the ground.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel unburying its hidden acorns for a feast.
meanings.sent4: The past unburying its ghosts in the present.
meanings.sent5: The storm unburying long-forgotten shipwrecks along the coast.
